page.title: 09TWO IMPORTANT HOUSES
page.content: 1.DORNEYWOOD HOUSE-was built about 50 years ago on the site of a farmhouse, S.W of the Beeches.It was given to the nation by its owner Lord Courtauld Thompson when he died.It is noe used by the Prime Minister or by certain members of the Government.The Lord Mayor of London may also use it.The gardens are open to the public in August and September,Saturdays 2-6pm. Bookings for are in writing to the Dorneywood trust.The entrance fee is one pound 2.ALLERDS-is an old house once part of the large Manor house that once stood there."Allerds" now stands was the Kitchen wing of the original Manor.The rest was pulled down on the orders of Lady Grenville.It may have been named after William de Alarde the landowner in 1234.The Â£E'shape of the original house indicates an Elizabethan building
